definition: to be fully aware of/to know perfectly well
Ming Dynasty (1368-1644)/surname Ming/Ming (c. 2000 BC), fourth of the legendary Flame Emperors, 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God
bright/opposite: dark 暗[an4]/(of meaning) clear/to understand/next/public or open/wise/generic term for a sacrifice to the gods
to ask a question, already knowing the answer
lit. to willfully go towards the mountain although knowing that it has tigers (idiom)/fig. to take a risk despite knowing the dangers
pinyin: ming2 zhi1 shan1 you3 hu3 , pian1 xiang4 hu3 shan1 xing2
containing_words.word: 明知山有虎，偏向虎山行

sentences.english: Offenses involving the provision of Renminbi funds with the knowledge of fraudulent purchase of foreign exchange shall be punished as an accomplice.
sentences.chinese: 明知用於騙購外匯而提供人民幣資金的，以共犯論處。

sentences.english: I know deep feeling is hurt, but still stubborn have not changed.
sentences.chinese: 我明知深情是害，可還固執的死性不改。

sentences.english: Why is knowing that fate has done, but also willing to love you?
sentences.chinese: 爲何明知緣分已盡，還心甘情願的愛着你？

sentences.english: Purus Duan knew full well that the situation was most perilous.
sentences.chinese: 段正淳明知情勢極是兇險。

sentences.english: She was ticketed for misdemeanor driving with a suspended license.
sentences.chinese: 她因明知吊銷執照而繼續駕車出行而再次被檢方起訴。

sentences.english: My bad temper, you asks, but already knows.
sentences.chinese: 我的壞脾氣，你明知故問。
明知不可能獲勝，他們還是進行了拼爭。

sentences.english: I asked, knowing full well what he meant.
Selling deliberately a commodity whose registered trademark is falsely used may constitute a crime.
sentences.chinese: 銷售明知是假冒註冊商標的商品可構成犯罪。

sentences.english: Nine-tenths of wisdom is being wise in time.
sentences.chinese: 聰明的百分之九十在於明知得及時。

sentences.english: Acknowledge of the illegality of the administrative action or lack of such acknowledge due to gross negligent .
sentences.chinese: 三明知原行政處分違法或因重大過失而不知者。

sentences.english: Courage is the discovery that you may not win, and trying when you know you can lose.
sentences.chinese: 勇氣，就是明知自己可能會輸，卻還是一往無前。

sentences.english: There is a love, which is clearly suffering, but not immune.
sentences.chinese: 有一種愛，明知是煎熬，卻又躲不開。

sentences.english: However the exception is in cases where the bearer acquired the instrument with the foreknowledge that such opposition existed.
sentences.chinese: 但是，持票人明知存在抗辯事由而取得票據的除外。

sentences.english: Or should she confront her husband, knowing that it might lead to divorce?
sentences.chinese: 或者明知這樣可能導致離婚，也要跟丈夫對質？

sentences.english: That can be the result, but also let the knife stabbed himself.
sentences.chinese: 明知會是這個結果，卻還要掄起這把刀捅傷自己。

definition: to take a risk out of desperation (idiom)
to believe (sth in relation to oneself)/to regard oneself as/to acknowledge (sth in relation to oneself)/to resign oneself to
to be determined to/to insist on
to obstinately persist in going about things the wrong way (idiom)
to conceal/to hide (a taboo subject)/to cover up the truth
